answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Pamela, 
For a public resource, this Florida Department of Education report discusses custodial benchmark and performance measurement in Florida school districts.  It includes organizational charts, staffing recommendations (including a custodial staffing formula on page 59 for determining the right number of custodial staff) and workload formulas to ensure cost effectiveness.
http://www.fldoe.org/edfacil/pdf/5_0.pdf
FMLink, a facilities management company, provides advice on benchmarking your custodial staff services through surveys and data analysis. 
http://www.fmlink.info/ProfResources/Benchmarking/article.cgi?Facility%20Issues:0306.html
http://www.fmlink.com/ProfResources/Benchmarking/article.cgi?Facility%20Issues:052507.html
Facilities Management also offers for pay services related to custodial benchmarking, though ICMA does not endorse or recommend their services in any way, other than to point you in the direction of a company that handles those services.
See also this useful article on the benefits of maintenance benchmarking from Cleaning and Maintenance Management Online:
http://www.cmmonline.com/article.asp?IndexID=6637148
Hope these links help your contact get started!
Derek Johnson

author: Pamela Muse
text:
The City of Tempe, AZ is looking for current statistics related to Custodial Services.  Such as average square feet of area cleaned per custodian per shift, etc.  Specifically, data that shows how the cost of cleaning changes as a building ages.    
Any information you can provide is appreciated!  
Thank you in advance for any help you can provide!  
Pamela Muse  
Western Regional Director  
Alliance for Innovation  
888-468-6450  
pmuse@transformgov.org  
www.transformgov.org
title: Custodial Services Statistics
